abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper concerns additional
            financing for the Ghana Community Based Rural Development
            Project (CBRDP). The project development objective is to
            strengthen the capacity of rural communities to enhance
            their quality of life by improving their productive assets,
            rural infrastructure, and access to key support services
            from private and public sources. The additional credit will
            help finance the costs associated with scaling up of CBRDP
            to reconstruct public goods in the flood-affected regions of
            the north, and extend support for decentralized service
            provision through the financing of basic public
            infrastructure by local level government authorities for an
            additional sixteen months of project implementation. The
            additional credit will also support further capacity
            building in relation to the expansion and extension of
            public works activities, and in support of decentralization
            as envisioned under the original project. Finally, the
            additional credit will support incremental program
            management costs related to these activities and an
            extension of the project implementation period.
